definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: I'm only paying back on old debt of thankfulness.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我只是在償還這份舊時的人情債。

sentences.english: The plaintiff loaned the defendant money, and the defendant failed to repay it.
sentences.chinese: 原告借給被告錢，被告到期不能償還。

sentences.english: The debt would be paid on the Greek calends.
sentences.chinese: 那筆債永遠也不會償還。

sentences.english: He does not suffer to pay off Karma from past lives.
sentences.chinese: 他從來不必爲償還過去欠下的孽債而忍受痛苦。

sentences.english: His father could not meet his bills.
Assuming the US pays back the debt, China will be richer.
sentences.chinese: 假如美國償還債務，中國將因此更加富有。

sentences.english: Debt is always liquidated. The only question is how you liquidate debt.
sentences.chinese: 債務總會被清償，唯一的問題是你會怎樣償還。

sentences.english: I sometimes find it a strain to be responsible for the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 我有時發現償還抵押借款是個負擔。

sentences.english: It troubles you for an hour, it repays you by immortality .
sentences.chinese: 它打擾你一小時，償還給你的卻是不朽的生命。

sentences.english: and that can be something that you pay off for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 可能畢業後的很長一段時間內都在償還欠下的貸款。

sentences.english: The debt can't be shed in bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 債務不會因破產而免予償還。

sentences.english: Both Italy and Spain insist they can service their debt.
sentences.chinese: 意大利和西班牙堅稱自己能償還債務。

sentences.english: Always pay more than the minimum payment toward your debt.
sentences.chinese: 經常在償還你的債款時，多付一點你能承受的最低量。

sentences.english: Over the next year, she will repay this loan in bi-weekly installments.
sentences.chinese: 一年後，她將每兩週分期償還貸款。

sentences.english: Quarterly reports come and go, but Greece will never repay these debts.
sentences.chinese: 季度報告來來去去，而希臘是不會償還這些債務的。

sentences.english: The wicked borrow and do not repay, but the righteous have mercy and share.
sentences.chinese: 惡人借貸總不償還，義人卻常好施樂善。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to be in debt/to incur debts/liability (finance)
to owe a debt/the sum owed
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
